intro: Parakeelya polypetala, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Parakeelya polypetala is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
